turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Did I wake you?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'm up.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: I had to call.  I jus got off the phone with James Kross.  Get this.  He wants to see you. Today.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: He wouldn't say.  Edward... I think we got him.  His nuts are on the block and <u>we got him</u>.  You there?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Give me twenty minutes.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: We'll be there.  Listen, if he's really caving in, we'll go from there down to the office.  I want him to commit his stock to us this morning.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: I don't think there's any sense in --

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Let him answer.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Oh, my god... Edward, no!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I suppose you'd use them as collateral on new loans, wouldn't you?

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Have you lost your mind?

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: What!?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Have a good day, gentlemen.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: You broke my nose.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I think I broke my hand.  You're fired.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Edward, we've been together ten years.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: And I don't like what we've become.  I'll cover any losses you have on this one.  Now get out, you asshole!

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: All this because of that whore!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You spent it on drugs, didn't you?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Hi, Viv.  Carlos, you know my roommate, Viv.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Carlos had some great rock.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I bet.  That was our rent!

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: We worked for that money.  We were gonna put together enough to get out of that dump we live in, get off this street.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Viv... don't be stupid.  We're whores.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I just saw somebody pulled out of a dumpster.  I wonder how much she made tonight?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Don't be mad at me.  I'll pay you back.  I promise.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I thought you were giving up that drug shit.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I will.  I'm trying.  Meanwhile I got some crack left, you wanna get high?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: No, let's go to work.  Okay?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Okay.  I'm sorry I said your dream was stupid.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Looks slow tonight.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Maybe we should get a pimp. Carlos likes you and --

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Forget it.  We work for it.  We keep it.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I can't handle this tonight. I'm going home.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: That crack is burning a hole in your pocket.  There isn't even milk in the fridge.  The rent's due.  Now come on --

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Hey, hey -- There's a rent.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: He's not gonna want us.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: 'Lo.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Kit!  Where've you been?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I was asleep.  You woke me.  You okay?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Kit, listen, the guy last night, the one in the Ferrari, I'm at this hotel, the Regent Beverly Wilshire, it's this absolutely unbelievable place and he's hired me for a whole week and Kit, listen, he's paying me three thousand bucks!  We can get out of the apartment.  We can get out of this town.  We can do anything!  Kit?  Hey, you there?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Why'd he want you?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: He... he just does.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I'm sorry, Viv'.  Carlos has been on my back.  Did you get the money up front like I taught ya'?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Three hundred for last night and he gave me extra to buy some clothes.  Now listen, I'm gonna leave an envelope for you at the front desk. Give me two hundred to the scum bucket and the other hundred to that asshole landlord for part of the rent.  Spend it on drugs and I'll pull your hair out.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I'm getting dressed now.  I'll be over.  Bye.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Hey Kit, where do I go for the clothes?  Good stuff on <u>him</u>.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: In Beverly Hills?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Baby!  Rodeo Drive.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yes, I'm glad you're clean but I've been calling and calling.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Was that you?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Who did you think?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Carlos.  I still owe him two hundred bucks...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Kit, I left that money for you days ago.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Yeah.  I just got it.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Kit...

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Everybody keeps starin' at me.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah... I know what you mean.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: What do you know?  You look <u>good</u>. All dressed up.  You clean up real nice.  You sure don't fit in down on the Boulevard, lookin' like you do.  Not that you ever did anyway.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You think I fit here where they just about chew your food for you?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Where do you fit?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I kissed him, Kit.  On the mouth.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Honey, you're not supposed to do that.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I know.  I stopped pretending and started liking it with him for real.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Oh, my god, you mean it was good?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: It was great.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Dummy.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: He wants to set me up in a place, give me some money.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I pray for that.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: All I'm doing is feeling lousy about it.  I don't know what to do.  What do I do, Kit?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Go for the bucks.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I don't care about bucks.  I might love this guy.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Wow, are you in deep shit.  You know he'll break your heart.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: So whatta' you going to do in San Francisco?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Get a job and probably go back to school.  Figure out what I'm gonna be.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: What kind of school?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: School, school.  Regular.  I used to get pretty good grades in school, you know.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: So did I.  I made it with the principal.  Study hard And get a "B."  Lift your dress and an "A" you'll see.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Want a pair of boots?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Do I!?  Momma!

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You sure you won't come with me?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: And leave all this?  Not in a million.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Couple a hours.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Yeah.  Well... I gotta split. Goodbye's make me crazy.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Cool your jets a second.  Here's some money.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: No.  You took care of rent, that's enough.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I want to.  For food, got it? Eat something before the wind blows you away.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I'm gonna pay you back next time I see ya, babe.  Just wait, I'm gonna do something real nice for you some day.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah, what?

turns.speaker: LANDLORD
turns.text: Rent.  You're late.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Don't give me that.  Kit gave it to you yesterday, cash.

turns.speaker: LANDLORD
turns.text: Kit give me nothin'.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You bullshittin' me?

turns.speaker: LANDLORD
turns.text: Of rent I do not bullshit.

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: Housekeeping.  I come to turn down the bed.  5:00, I turn down the bed.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: <u>Housekeeping</u>.  I come to turn down the bed.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Is that all?  You just fold back the bedspread?

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: I also place las chocolates on the pillow.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Oooh, I love those.

turns.speaker: MAID
turns.text: I leave extras, miss.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Thanks!  Consuelo, are all rich people so lazy they can't do this on their own?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I'm just going to my room.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: You're a guest here?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I'm -- I'm with a friend.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: And who is that?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I... Edward...

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Vivian.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Miss Vivian... things that go on in other hotels don't happen at the Regent Beverly Wilshire.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Niece?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Of course.  Naturally when Mr. Harris leaves, I won't see you in this hotel again.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I got a dress.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: I rather hoped you'd be wearing it.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I didn't want to get it messed. I got shoes too.  Wanna see?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: That's all right.  I'm sure they're quite lovely.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: They were real nice to me there. They treated me, y'know... nice. Thanks, Barney.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: What is it, Miss Vivian?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Edward is taking me to some fancy place for dinner.  The Rex.  Ever been there?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: It's a bit beyond my... range, shall we say.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah, mine too.  Is it like, y'know, normal?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: I think you'll find it normal enough.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Will I like it?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: You'll like it fine.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Okay.  Thanks, Barney.  You're the best.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: In fifteen minutes I can teach you everything you need to know to dine with the Queen.  First, as you pick up the knife you shift your fork to the left hand.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: But I always eat like this.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Either you're European or badly brought up.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Hmmm... I vonder vich.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Actually, some of the richest people I know have the worst manners.  Of course, Mr. Harris, being of old money, knows his way around a table.  All right now, pay attention please.  Salad fork.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What if they serve soup?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: They will serve salad.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: But what if they serve soup?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Then you use your <u>soup spoon</u>.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I like steak.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Then you would use your--

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Steak spoon!

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Miss Vivian --

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Maybe I'll just order a burger, Barney, that way I can eat with my hands.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Miss Vivian... there's a salon here in the hotel.  Instead of worrying unnecessarily about table manners, why don't you just have your hair done instead?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Professionally?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Barnard Thomas here.  Miss Vivian, I wonder if you might come down to the front desk.  There's someone here to see you.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: I'd send them up, but sadly, I don't trust the young lady to find you on her own.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Hi, Barney!

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Miss Vivian.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Look I just wanted to say goodbye.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Mr. Harris doesn't check out until tomorrow.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah, well, I check out today.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: You're not accompanying him to New York?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Come on, Barney, you and me live in the real world.  You don't know how to treat a girl like anything but a lady, Mr. Thomas.

turns.speaker: MR. THOMAS
turns.text: Certain ladies make that very easy... Vivian.  John, call a limousine for our guest, please.  Have it take her anywhere she wishes to go.  Bill the hotel.  See you again sometime soon.

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: May I help you?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I'm just looking, thanks.

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: Are you looking for something in particular?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yes.  Something... conservative.

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You have beautiful things.  How much is this?

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: I don't think it would fit you.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I didn't ask if it would fit. I asked how much it was.

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: It's very expensive.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What is with you?

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I'm going to spend <u>money</u>.

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: I don't think we have anything for you here.  You're obviously in the wrong place.

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: Would you like to try it on?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: 'Scume me.

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Do you remember me?

turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: No, I'm sorry, I don't.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I was in here yesterday.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Having a good time, Vivian?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: All this must be quite a change from Hollywood Boulevard.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: It's okay.  Edward told me.  Your secret's safe with me.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Yeah.  Sure.  Why not.  Call me at the Regent Beverly Wilshire.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: I just might do that.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Do you want to know what he did? Do you want to know what the crazy son of a bitch did?  He handed the whole thing back to Kross! On a silver platter.  For no reason!  What was he thinking, I mean, what was going through his goddam head?  Why?  What was all that benevolent crap?  What are we going to become, a philanthropic foundation?  I'll probably be the director of several worthwhile charities.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I think it's great.

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: I bet.  A lousy whore and you're the gum in a hundred million dollar deal.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Aw, come on, Bill.  It's just business.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Get out!

turns.speaker: STUCKEY
turns.text: Don't worry.  I'll pay for it. What a you charge?  Huh?  Twenty, thirty, fifty bucks, <u>maybe</u>?  Are you a fifty dollar whore?

turns.speaker: ALBINO
turns.text: Don't even think --  -- don't even think about trying to escape. The chains are far too thick. And don't dream of being rescued either. The only way in is secret. And only the Prince, the Count, and I know how to get in and out.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Then I'm here till I die?

turns.speaker: ALBINO
turns.text: Till they kill you. Yeah.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Then why bother curing me?

turns.speaker: ALBINO
turns.text: The Prince and the Count always insist on everyone being healthy before they're broken.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: So it's to be torture.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: You don't believe me?

turns.speaker: ALBINO
turns.text: You survived the Fire Swamp. You must be very brave...  ... but nobody withstands The Machine. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                           69.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: If we surrender, and I return with you, will you promise not to hurt this man?

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: May I live a thousand years and never hunt again.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: He is a sailor on the pirate ship "Revenge." Promise to return him to his ship.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: I swear it will be done.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: My Westley will always come for me.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: I suggest a deal. You write four copies of a letter. I'll send my four fastest ships. One in each direction. The Dread Pirate Roberts is always close to Florin this time of year. We'll run up the white flag and deliver your message. If Westley wants you, bless you both. If not ... please consider me as an alternative to suicide. Are we agreed?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: He will come for me.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: Ah! My dulcet darling. Tonight we marry. Tomorrow morning, your men will escort us to Florin Channel where every ship in my armada waits to accompany us on our honeymoon.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Every ship but your four fastest, you mean.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Every ship but the four you sent.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: Yes. Yes, of course. Naturally, not those four.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: You never sent the ships. Don't bother lying. It doesn't matter. Westley will come for me anyway.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: You're a silly girl.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Yes, I am a silly girl, for not having seen sooner that you were nothing but a coward with a heart full of fear.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: I-would-not-say-such things-if- Iwere-you-

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Why not? You can't hurt me. Westley and I are joined by the bonds of love. And you cannot track that. Not with a thousand bloodhounds. And you cannot break it. Not with a thousand swords. And when I say you are a coward, that is only because you are the slimiest weakling ever to crawl the earth.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: You don't seem excited, my little muffin.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Should I be?

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: Brides often are, I'm told.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: I do not marry tonight.

turns.speaker: HUMPERDINCK
turns.text: I killed him myself.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Then why is there fear behind your eyes?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: I am no one to be trifled with, that is all you ever need know.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: To think -- all that time it was your cup that was poisoned.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: They were both poisoned. I spent the last few years building up an immunity to iocane powder.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Catch your breath.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: If you'll release me ... whatever you ask for ransom ... you'll get it, I promise you...

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: And what is that worth, the promise of a woman? You're very funny, Highness.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: I was giving you a chance. No matter where you take me ... there's no greater hunter than Prince Humperdinck. He could track a falcon on a cloudy day. He can find you

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: I never said he was my dearest love. And yes, he will save me. That I know.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: You admit to me you do not love your fiance?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: He knows I do not love him.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: "Are not capable of love" is what you mean.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: I have loved more deeply than a killer like yourself could ever dream.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Rest, Highness.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: I know who you are -- your cruelty reveals everything.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: You're the Dread Pirate Roberts; admit it.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: With pride. What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: You can die slowly cut into a thousand pieces.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Hardly complimentary, Your Highness. Why loose your venom on me?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: On the high seas, your ship attacked, and the Dread Pirate Roberts never takes prisoners.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: I can't afford to make exceptions. Once word leaks out that a pirate has gone soft, people begin to disobey you, and then it's nothing but work, work, work, all the time.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: You mock my pain!

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Life is pain, Highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something. I remember this farm boy of yours, I think. This would be, what, five years ago?

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Does it bother you to hear?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Nothing you can say will upset me.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: He died well, that should please you. No bribe attempts or blubbering. He simply said, "Please. Please, I need to live." It was the "please" that caught my memory.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                           53.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: I asked him what was so important for him. "True love," he replied. And then he spoke of a girl of surpassing beauty and faithfulness. I can only assume he meant you. You should bless me for destroying him before he found out what you really are.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: And what am I?

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Faithfulness he talked of, madam. Your enduring faithfulness. Now, tell me truly. When you found out he was gone, did you get engaged to your prince that same hour, or did you wait a whole week out of respect for the dead?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: You mocked me once, never do it again -- I died that day!

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: ... as ... you ... wish...

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Oh, my sweet Westley; what have I done?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Farm boy. Polish my horse's saddle. I want to see my face shining in it by morning.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: As you wish.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Farm Boy. Fill these with water --  --please.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: As you wish.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: I fear I'll never see you again.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Of course you will.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: But what if something happens to you?

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Hear this now: I will come for you.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: But how can you be sure?

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: This is true love. You think this happens every day?

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Can you move at all?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Move? You're alive. If you want, I can fly.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: I told you, "I would always come for you." Why didn't you wait for me?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Well ... you were dead.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Death cannot stop true love. All it can do is delay it for a while.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: I will never doubt again.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: There will never be a need.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: We'll never survive.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Singed a bit, were you?

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: This will all soon be but a happy memory because Roberts' ship "Revenge" is anchored at the far end. And I, as you know, am Roberts.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: But how is that possible, since he's been marauding twenty years and you only left me five years ago?

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Finally, Roberts decided something. He said, "All right, Westley, I've never had a valet. You can try it for tonight. I'll most likely kill you in the morning." Three years he said that. "Good night, Westley. Good work. Sleep well. I'll most likely kill you in the morning." It was a fine time for me. I was learning to fence, to fight, anything anyone would teach me. And Roberts and I eventually became friends. And then it happened.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: What? -- go on --

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: We'll never succeed -- we may as well die here.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: No. No. We have already succeeded.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: I mean, what are the three terrors of the Fire Swamp? One, the flame spurts. No problem. There's a popping sound preceding each, we can avoid that. Two, the Lightning Sand. But you were clever enough to discover what that looks like, so in the future we can avoid that too.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Westley, what about the R.O.U.S.'s?

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Rodents of Unusual Size? I don't think they exist...

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: We did it.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Oh, Westley, darling.  Westley, why won't you hold me?

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Gently.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: At a time like this that's all you can think to say? "Gently?"

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Gently!!

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Oh, Westley, will you ever forgive me?

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: What hideous sin have you committed lately?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: I got married. I didn't want to. It all happened so fast.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: It never happened.

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: But it did. I was there. This old man said, "Man and wife."

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Did you say, "I do"?

turns.speaker: BUTTERCUP
turns.text: Well, no, we sort of skipped that part.

turns.speaker: WESTLEY
turns.text: Then you're not married -- if you didn't say it, you didn't do it  -- wouldn't you agree, Your Highness?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: I did that on purpose. I don't have to miss.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: I believe you -- So what happens now?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: We face each other as God intended. Sportsmanlike. No tricks, no weapons, skill against skill alone.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: You mean, you'll put down your rock and I'll put down my sword, and we'll try to kill each other like civilized people?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: I could kill you now.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Frankly, I think the odds are slightly in your favor at hand fighting.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: It's not my fault being the biggest and the strongest. I don't even exercise. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                           38.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Look are you just fiddling around with me or what?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: I just want you to feel you're doing well. I hate for people to die embarrassed.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: You're quick.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: And a good thing too.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Why do you wear a mask? Were you burned by acid, or something like that? ---------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                           39.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Why is that, do you think?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Well, I haven't fought just one person for so long. I've been specializing in groups. Battling gangs for local charities, that kind of thing.

turns.speaker: MAN IN BLACK
turns.text: Why should that make such a difference?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Well ...  ... you see, you use different moves when you're fighting half a dozen people than when you only have to be worried about one.

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: It's fabric from the uniform of an Army officer of Guilder.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Who's Guilder?

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: The country across the sea. The sworn enemy of Florin.  Go!

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: Once the horse reaches the castle, the fabric will make the Prince suspect the Guilderians have abducted his love. When he finds her body dead on the Guilder frontier, his suspicions will be totally confirmed.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: You never said anything about killing anyone.

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: I've hired you to help me start a war. That's a prestigious line of work with a long and glorious tradition.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: I just don't think it's right, killing an innocent girl.

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: Am I going mad or did the word "think" escape your lips? You were not hired for your brains, you hippopotamic land mass.

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: No more rhymes now, I mean it.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Anybody want a peanut?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: I only dog paddle.

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: Veer left. Left. Left!

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: Faster!

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: I thought I was going faster.

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: You were supposed to be this colossus. You were this great, legendary thing. And yet he gains.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Well, I'm carrying three people. And he's got only himself.

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: -- I do not accept excuses.  I'm just going to have to find myself a new giant, that's all.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Don't say that, Vizzini. Please.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: You be careful.  -- people in masks cannot be trusted.

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: I'm waiting!

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: Give her to me.  Catch up with us quickly.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: What do I do?

turns.speaker: VIZZINI
turns.text: Finish him, finish him. Your way.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Oh, good, my way. Thank you, Vizzini.  Which way is my way?

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: Probably he means no harm.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: He's really very short on charm.

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: Oh, you've a great gift for rhyme.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Yes, some of the time.

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: FEZZIK, are there rocks ahead?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: If there are, we'll all be dead.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: It's you.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: True!

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: You don't look so good.  You don't smell so good either.

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: Perhaps not. I feel fine.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: He's with the Prince in the Castle. But the castle gate is guarded by thirty men.

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: How many could you handle?

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: I don't think more than ten.

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: That leaves twenty for me. At my best, I could never defeat that many.  I need Vizzini to plan. I have no gift for strategy. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                           82.

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: No -- not Vizzini -- I need the Man in Black --

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: -- what? --

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: -- look, he bested you with strength, your greatness. He bested me with steel. He must have outthought Vizzini, and a man who can do that can plan my castle's onslaught any day. Let's go --

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: -- where?

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: To find the Man in Black, obviously.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: But you don't know where he is.

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: Don't bother me with trifles; after twenty years, at last, my father's soul will be at peace.

turns.speaker: FEZZIK
turns.text: The Man in Black?

turns.speaker: INIGO
turns.text: His true love is marrying another tonight, so who else has cause for Ultimate Suffering?  Excuse me --
